page.title: 07Norton, Chatterley Whitfield
page.content: Near Ball Green is the Chatterley Whitfield mining museum which is very popular with lots of interesting things to see related to the history of coal mining. The Drift Gallery shows mining from the first mines to today, using models and machines, to give a clear and exciting picture of life in the mines. The Steam Winding Engine which once carried coal and miners up and down the shaft is massive the size and shape are amazing. It may be working by 1985. But the most exciting part is going underground in the mine, with helmet and light,a battery belted around you. The shaft goes down a dizzy 717 feet. But do not panic because once there a guide will show you round the mine workings and describe how coal used to be mined there. Altogether a unique and educational experiance.
